fkcC5-P5ZWTp7hPwxFvKEQ.text: First, let me start this off by saying I LOVE Smokey Bones.  I eat here quite frequently, but tonight's visit left a lot to be desired.  I had my usual, petite sirloin, baked sweet potato, and broccoli.  Waitress seemed like she didn't want to wait on my table. She acted like I was a bother.  Dinner arrives, and my sirloin is way small-- as in much smaller than the 6 oz that I usually get.  This looked to be about 4 oz. size. Baked sweet potato turned into sweet potato fries.  Manager was sent over, and I said I had ordered a baked sweet potato. She proceeded to argue with me that they NEVER had baked sweet potatoes on the menu, and she has been there since they opened.  Also inquired about size of the steak.  She insisted (again arguing with me) that it was a 6 oz. size.  I didn't mention that I was never offered a refill on my drink or my broccoli was cold.  She told me she would comp my dinner "since you're not satisfied" (done in a very snotty tone).  Waitress brought check, didn't offer dessert, or a drink refill.  And guess what... no comp for dinner, but that was more than okay because I ate it.    Waitress needs retraining because she messed up two other orders.   Overall, a bad dining experience.  I' think I'll sit out of Smokey Bones for a long while until service improves.    Sad, because I really do love this place.

HikeLkN7QgEErkUMICFDPA.text: Lets start this by me saying that you have to take Smokey Bones for what it is, a chain BBQ restaurant outside of BBQ country.  With that said the food here is pretty good, not the best BBQ I've ever had, not even close, but like I said, you need to take it for what it is.  What made my experience really good at the Pittsburgh Mills location was our waitress, Michelle.  She had a really great personality, was "on it" with drinks; Michelle was the best "server" I have ever had, and that goes with some of the really high end restaurants I've had the pleasure of dining at.    Solid food and spectacular service.

0tZVQt8eUGFwkbBpY1HUBw.text: Do not eat here! This is a chain I understand but me and my friend got some type of "food positioning" after eating there! We got an appetizer sampler which was ok but after we got outlet entrees that's when things went wrong! He got ribs which were dry and tough. I got a three meat platter and the brisket was like slices of hard ago leather. I know this is a chain but REALLY? I also got smoked wings which were ok but dry then the smoked sliced turkey was good but the seasoning tasted weird. All I can say is never been that violently ill after a meal and my friend felt the same way the next day!

hzEl7U8xhFsg1EcvcvoMSQ.text: Very good tender ribs. Quick friendly service and they have that new pay system that makes things easy. Would be 5 stars but place is pricey for what you get.

ij2dVn9Oqa8-xdnBNuNhtA.text: Smokey Bones is good BBQ in my opinion, and we had no problem with the service. Arrived late on a Sunday night and they were happy to attend to all the customers there as long as we stayed.  A beauftiful glaze on the BBQ chicken was the highlight for me. Good ribs, good everything. Apple wontons for dessert were a big hit. Every chain restaurant should be this good.

AzNgXbJstGh_8mIl8Zll7A.text: All in all, there is nothing "consistently" wrong with Smokey Bones. I'm not saying every customer has had a good experience in every facet every time they go. I'm saying if something went wrong it's probably a fluke. I've had a manager contact me about an issue I had and I usually like what I see. I am sorry for anyone who had a negative experience, I feel bad because the food and service is good. I agree about the wings, you can trust the other posts. Get the smoked wings.

68CZrw33EQ_8QdD2QrdR8A.text: Pretty decent. Not the best bbq but not the worst. I like the dry rub. I don't like ribs that fall out clean, and these don't. I like meat to bite off the rib.

PfkM8o507j_oFhQF0SETBg.text: Loud, dirty, scummy food and drunk servers. Pass.

w96PpRXccPMAR_p1c7FoNw.text: Like someone else says, you get what you get going here. It's a chain BBQ place, so don't expect mind blowing food. Nice customer service, very friendly. Some decent drink specials if you go at the right time. Ribs are okay. I've made much better myself, but than again, it took 5 hours. Okay I guess for a chain place.

jlPimfXNvJS4N0owK9PcwA.text: Best ribs around, even with the rib fest here now I prefer to come here been coming here a while now haven't been dissappointed yet

F3Z1dhbtZFh6SmUFRSbP_w.text: Do yourself a favor and stay away!  The staff does not care enough about their customers for you to waste your time  We had issues with our order, our check, and even though we asked to speak to the manager he never came over to ask if everything was ok or to settle any of the issues.  The bartender who came over to talk to us about the problem we had with our beers was rude and was clueless about what he was pouring.  The food is very mediocre.  Overall, bad experience.

7_IRLb26N_7EpEh4FjFuCQ.text: Very Bad service...food tastes like it is pre cooked and they warm it up for you....We tried this place 2 times and ordered different items each time.. same thing bad food bad service.

Gj0GKZWEwYpNXDuyPgh_bg.text: We had a great visit here with friends and we can't wait to go back - food was wonderful, service was fantastic and the Manager Patrick was very friendly.

L1eaY0J62UZukw0W9pXOjA.text: Went in to check it out.  Worse decision I have made in a long time.  I was served water with a rotten lemon.  The brisket was decent, pulled pork dry, Smokey wings burnt, and regular wing ruined by adding texaspete hot sauce. This place is not the best, and probably had seen better days.  Recommend avoid and save your money. Expensive!!!!  Way to expensive for crappy food.

MVLz7nPQ5UtfYWGplCo9HA.text: I know ribs as customer cook and sous chef in high end restaurants   The rack I had was dry, tough, and salty with no crust. I left half of them. I was a breath away from sending them back but didn't want to deal with the drama.  Gin and tonic didn't have a lime and I had to ask for water refills. And those are the fact in the case

PbGLlWHlZ9IMV_MDHklK6g.text: First stop at this smokey bones. Food has really changed and not for the good at the Bones since they opened in our area. Still a decent place to stop for beer.

D2xfkuyd1JRkr1GBFJE8eg.text: My family visited this store and the food was fantastic! We loved the smoked wings with the sweet bbq sauce! The Hawaiian ribeye was so tender and delicious. Will definitely visit again!

XRiDiCJ-Bgtst1OJC3-Lag.text: Never a complaint. Always good food and good service. The portions are plenty and alot of options to choose from. The various seasoned sauces at the table add to the flavors. The spiced sausage is very good.

HwdMLQZtzu2eQ6WIDDvpYQ.text: This place was over priced and absolutely not worth the hour wait. We paid 18 dollars for 3 ribs and some broccoli. The waitress was rude. We waited for an hour. Good luck!

vLfFGUr7uq5P0cDV1w3UNg.text: The food is ok most of the time. The wait staff is friendly enough though they seem rushed. The rest of the experience was disgusting. Everything that was served to us was on or in something horrifyingly dirty and greasy. Last time at this franchise for everyone in my group today. Ew.

571nI7lMWGEOMeDAZjcLdw.text: This chain is going downhill.  Two adults ordered the same meal and the one had less than the other.  Also the kids mac and cheese is made with queso which has jalapeno in it. A kids meal should not be made with hot peppers.  Unless some changes happen we probably won't go back.

0rfbKTEGu0jDMIJ3kcOPwA.text: We asked how long it would take to be seated. Hostess told us 5 minutes. We went to the bar and I notices 2 names above ours, a 3 and a 2. After some time, I noticed that several couples, like us, were being seated. I went to the hostess 2 more times, making sure they hadn't forgotten about us. At one point, I mentioned several empty tables. I was told they didn't have staff to cover those tables. Finally, we got seated.  We ordered coffee and the waiter brought it, with no spoon. We didn't notice right away, since I ordered an appetizer. The plate of loaded fries was small for the price, and he asked if we wanted small plates. He dropped the wrapped silverware and plates, got our entree order and dashed off before I could mention the spoon. No problem. She used the wrapped fork.  A food runner brought our entrees, picked up the small plates and dashed away. I realized that we had no extra napkins, just the single ones that contained our fork and knife. I couldn't locate the waiter, and my guest was missing one of her sides.   A quarter chicken consists of a tiny leg and thigh. The brisket was dry, burned and had a lot of fat in it. My guest complained of the same thing. She had the pulled pork and said it was passable. The waiter finally made an appearance, and I advised him of the issues. He brought a few napkins and a food runner brought our missing side, but by this time, we were nearly finished.  He stopped once more to ask about dessert. We asked for the check and got excellent service on that. I guess when it is time to pay, the pace of the place gets quick. It took a while, though, to get my change. I got the feeling that we were expected to leave the change as the tip.  No one asked how our meal was, no one ever came by to check on us. The energy level of the place was rushed and unpleasant. I had heard good things, but the food quality and value were poor at best, and the service was terrible. Perhaps other locations are better.

S92ocxa-MjyXGsYvMpS9QA.text: Server was distant, but worst was the bathroom.  The last time I was in it was bad, and I complained, but it  had not changed.  The problem is the self-flushing toilets DO NOT FLUSH!  I mentioned it to the people  seating everyone but both times I could tell they really 'didn't care'.   Go to Longhorn!

mpzZXI6xzZtFZLheBKp0eg.text: Smokey Bones Bar and Fire Grill is a chain store steakhouse.    Atmosphere:  4 stars Restrooms: 2 stars -- could have used a bit of cleaning Waitress we had:  4 stars BBQ we ate:  3.5 stars Price:  3.5 stars    If management would care a little more about the cleanliness of their store, the training of their staff to take pride in their surroundings and the cleanliness of the restrooms, I'd throw in another star.

kk9BwNvCwBndf4QEuUYpgg.text: BEST RIBS EVER!  I love the baby back ribs with a dry rub at Smokey Bone's in Tarentum!  The ribs are so soft and fall right off the bone.  Absolutely delicious!  My husband really likes their wings.  Ambiance is not my favorite because I don't like sports bars.  But I'll deal with the TVs and bar atmosphere in order to have the BEST ribs ever!  I recommend a baked potato or broccoli for sides.  Warning:  the broccoli comes heavily buttered; but you may ask for no butter on the broccoli.  Caesar salad is OK but I didn't care for the mixed greens in the regular side garden salad.  Another perk is a yummy slice of warm garlic toast is served with the ribs platter.  Nice drink options and competent wait-staff.

YWI3flse0OeswhCyfVMetA.text: A decent bar/grill restaurant but definitely overpriced and loaded with extremely unhealthy meals. The food is decent,I have never had a bad experience to speak of and the service is usually solid and speedy. The food itself is what I have a problem with the most. Its definitely over priced for the quality and Im not sure how they prepare some of their meals but looking up the nutrition information online is shocking. 810 calories in one serving of sweet potato fries...seriously? 890 calories in 8 very small smoked wings is also shocking although they are very tasty I did not expect them to be that high. The burgers are certainly nothing to brag about and the fact that they are priced higher than Burgatory makes it even more disappointing. I ordered an all Angus beef patty that was very plain and average tasting certainly not comparably to the juicy delicious flavor of a burger from Burgatory.   Overall a nice bar/restaurant setting with speedy/friendly service but for what your getting the food is overpriced.

qYM2Af3DPQ7GbeAJG6McPA.text: I don't automatically look down on chain restaurants. If they get the job done right, I can still be a fan.   Have visited this place at least 8 times over a couple years. If you go for dinner on Friday or Saturday, you'll have a wait. I've sat at the bar a couple times while waiting and found the pours to be on the generous side.  We try not to go those nights because the bar can be full and I don't want to stand for 30-45 minutes.  I am a rib fan and I love their ribs. I mean I LOVE them. To the point where I know that's what I'm going to have every time. Only on one occasion was I less than very satisfied (that time the ribs were dry and chewy) but besides that one-off experience they have been moist and meaty with a little bark on the outside - the way I like them.  Never had a problem with service - prompt, friendly, cheery and attentive. There's an assortment of 4 BBQ sauces at the table that you can choose from, and you can also order the ribs smoked and sauced, or smoked and dry rubbed. Geez, my mouth is watering now.   I've had the smoked wings as an appetizer and they were great. I would skip the mac-n-cheese side as it's a couple of dollar upcharge and was nothing to write home about.  My wife is partial to the pulled pork platter paired with the Carolina-style sauce, and she says to mention that the broccoli side is always a winner, cooked just right.  And if you've thrown caution to the wind for your dining experience, try the hot donuts for dessert, with chocolate and raspberry dipping sauces. They are wonderful.  It's probably a good thing that it's a long-ish drive for us or I'd likely be gorging on those ribs far too often. Ribs, mmm.

LJ1EaguA7e6VFBSk75oDYg.text: Meh.  Sticky floors, dry flavorless meat, squishy broccoli, crying kids, and lots of screens.  What's not to like?  Decent service and good wifi but that's not a reason to return here.

6bCATIw1S1Xo-WsOFsrEoQ.text: The wings were fantastic. Cooked nice and slow and with the house sauce made it even better.   The burger was Alright. Not great. Expecting more from a burger from a BBQ restaurant.   Onion Straw and bacon are common though out burger joints. If they would put some meat ( pulled pork, burnt ends Sausage, etc)  it would make this BBQ different, which is a good thing.

0NuMuPQvlNGxot8bSs7qkA.text: Nice place.  Food was pretty good.   Have one complaint.  The pitchers for beer have this huge tube in the center that is supposed to hold ice to keep the beer cold.  They don't put ice in them so to me it just took up space in the pitcher.  Order bottles or a glass of beer.  Pitchers are a ripoff.

pAKrlafSeVLj-aKpNvXudA.text: I've been prompted urgently to write a review.   I'm here with several family members for a reunion in the Pittsburgh area. After gathering our belongings to head for a four and a half hour trip back home we stop at Smokey Bones. One family member was familiar with their food, so with a party of 17 we were on our way. Waiting for our tables to be combined was not long. However, what was long was our wait to receive our food.   The restaurant was NOT crowed, busy, whatever. But somehow we waited for our food for two hours. My aunt and her friend actually received service by another employee, yet they still waited a good while for their food. Keep in mind people who were seated around the same time or after we were seated received their food promptly.   After that two hours of waiting, the manager appeared, but was unapologetic and offered an excuse, which was a lie, that they were busy. It wasn't. Most of us who dine out often know what busy looks like. That excuse and her attitude did not sit well with the family.   They expressed how unsatisfied they were and then we offered with bread. Which, I think, should come out to the table anyways. We should have compensated with an actual appetizer.   Afterwards, the food came out about five minutes later. Some family members were satisfied, others not so much. The chicken sandwich I had was nothing to tell anyone about. I believe the same goes for everyone else's meal. I made sure to ask everyone how they enjoyed their meal.   The meals were discounted but still the discount should have been a bit deeper. All of us has to be some where the next day, children were waiting to eat, we spent a long time waiting, and the manager did not strategize how to approach our table of 17 people who have a long road ahead of them.  NOTE: this review was sitting in my edit back log on my yelp app, but still, I remember this experience like it was yesterday. This place might have single-handedly halted my yelp reviews. No matter, I see new reviews coming.

_jVdPXSM9toT-orO7UEfvA.text: Came for dinner on 5/19/19, had great food and service from our waiter! Love the BBQ ribs! However the table next to us, had an extremely rude and entitled customer who was treating their server/food runner very rude.  This customer was complaining about the price of a wine and wanted a discount, something that is out of control for any staff that works there.   Ive worked in customer service for years, and I needed to speak up because their server/food runner, Kylie, was giving that table great customer service, with a genuine smile, and tried her best to make the customer happy.   This customer literally waved her hand in front of Kylie saying "I'm not going to sit here all day and talk to you about this".  I was appalled at how rude this customer was. She even asked another server what Kylie's name was and wanted her to write it down so she could complain about her, saying for "customer service reason" she should have gotten what she wanted.   I spoke to the manager to let her know I witnessed the whole thing and this entitled customer is planning on writing a complaint that is so far from what the reality of the situation was and I wanted to write a positive review for Kylie.   My hope is that if this crazy rude customer tries to get Kylie in trouble or complain about her, that this review will negate her False claims and show that Kylie did a great job handling a difficult situation/customer, so much that a random customer (myself) felt compelled enough to write this review.  Great customer service Kylie, keep it up! That's how you get customers like me coming back :)

qaxKGEfeVpOWsY4D5mGwyw.text: HORRIBLE!  The restaurant was dirty, the food was wrong,  the "clean" silverware had food on it.   We ordered 3 burgers, all different and from their specialty menu medium-well, 2 of 3 were medium still a good bit of pink plus one was not the specialty burger that was ordered.  The soup my husband ordered came out as 1/2 a bowl with a spoon the had food hanging off it and a greasy film.  The waitress was nice but didn't offer anything more than a sorry when we brought it to her attention. This was one of our go to restaurants when we went to the Pittsburgh Mills, not any more. There was crud under the tables, the seats coverings had tears in the fabric and both the men's and women's bathrooms needed cleaning.

perSS6SZ57z4j8o1uZC3UQ.text: The bathroom in a restaurant, tells you how clean the rest of the place is.. The Kitchen is unsanitary.. I wouldn't take my animals to have dinner here.. you stick to the bathroom floor .. ruined my appetite..terrible service.. a sad place

swU0OgNCOh2OjjQ5oGBEMQ.text: Anytime I leave a poor reviews, I have a secret hope it can be turned around. I hope maybe a review like mine will be a wakeup call. This was one of those times maybe I was right. After my last poor experience I was contacted by the regional manager who was extremely concerned and truly listened. They really DO read reviews on here , and they care. We ended up being sent a gift card as an act of good faith or an 'apology' of sorts. I'm happy to report we used it already. From the time we arrived to the time we left it was nothing short of phenomenal. The smells alone wafting from the back we're heavenly. The server was amazing. It was lunch time and it was slower as it was a weekday , but they had plenty of take out so they weren't 'dead'.  We decided to go for it and got their famous ribs as well as their pulled pork . We really wanted the brisket but it's not available until 4pm. I can say it was brought out  very quickly and we never had to wait for our server to stop by and check on us. The ribs were literally melt in your mouth. We tried pretty much every sauce they had. The smoked wings were delicious and for those alone we will come back. We went in with an open mind and never once mentioned to ANYONE about the previous experience. Perhaps that evening of poor service  was a one time thing. Even the most fantastic places have off nights. This afternoon however they knocked it out of the park.we loved it, and we will definitely go back. The only reason it's not.a five star review is because the brisket isn't available until 4pm. Even with that we had no complaints. Thank you.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokey Bones Bar & Fire Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States
Photo of Smokey Bones Bar & Fire Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States
Photo of Smokey Bones Bar & Fire Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States

hii3FCj0aQp_yLUZXLR3JA.text: Why-oh-why did we come back to this spot. It's like we forgot how horrible it was. Again, poor service, and food was terrible. Both meals somehow arrived cold AND overcooked/burnt. We ordered the nachos for an appetizer and the chips tasted stale and musty. No amount of coupons makes this place worth a return visit.

7kCVgWkysq4BdZXxx1bYEw.text: I stopped coming here well over a year ago because the service was always bad. But my husband wanted ribs this past labor day, I was reluctant but obliged. Got here around 130 pm and the place was packed. We put our name on the wait list with the server who just happened to be our waitress. I watched her for the next 10 minutes run around that place to get everyone taken care of with a great attitude, like she actually wanted to be there. We were finally sat and Angela first apologized about the wait before she even proceeded to tell us her name. Clearly not her fault but it was a nice touch. She gave us some great recommendations for drinks and appetizers that were awesome. We got our food in a timely matter and she had conversation for everyone she was waiting on, even though they were extremely busy. I told her that as long as she is there we will be sure to come back. Great come up smokey bones.

s0GW1Y5NgHHY0ysvKdRe_A.text: Haven't been to smokey bones in a while and I will tell you why. I ordered 8 buffalo chicken wings, a Caesar salad, and a side of fries. Salad and fries were delicious I'm not going to knock them. The wings were cooked well but had almost no buffalo sauce on them. Our waitress didn't bring us any extra napkins. She only filled our drinks once. The bathroom was sticky and smelled like urine.

NiRj0eqit5sSUonw6JfpiQ.text: I am reasonable on reviews. All it takes to get a 5 star rating from me is to provide excellent service by people who really seem to care that your pleased, serve really good food and only charge a reasonable amount for the food. Have a nice place with clean rest rooms. That's all it takes..and Smokey Bones nails it.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokey Bones Bar & Fire Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States

IsQOYXw1Sf6wDFYh2wAxFA.text: Last night I came in with my Daughter and Husband for wing night and it was delicious! My daughter got the usual Mac n cheese and she was pleased; I had the Garlic Parmesan and the husband got some smoked spicy garlic buffalo wings and we loved our wings. Service was great, the restaurant was clean, the food came fast  We were not disappointed. We will gladly be back.

UvZSWvzLCaiN07I5UU8NEg.text: We made the mistake of having a late lunch here yesterday for my sisters birthday. (2pm). The restaurant was not crowded at all. There were 6 of us. Service was extremely slow, at least 20 minutes before we got our appetizers, which we had to ask for plates to share. Wrong food was brought out to one of the members of our party, the drinks were placed on the wrong tabs. Food was not up to par, ribs were chewy. Our waitress was extremely slow in replenishing soft drinks. All in all just got a " we don't care" vibe.

j_79f6FkTl0t69FhvYUKNw.text: Crazy rude. Especially the mgr. Wont return to this location. Deleted my app. The wait staff act as if your bothering them. Called the 1800 number. They just made excuses.

qlksZ-XY6cB9gHbvtl8_cg.text: I am so done with this place.   Only my 3rd time, but will be my last.   First, our server was more interested in chatting with the table next to us, so we couldn't get any attention.   My husband and I ordered the blackberry iced tea........mistake number 1.   It is so sweet that it's disgusting.    I ordered the nachos as my entree and had them add pulled pork.   My husband got a combination that had dry rub ribs and wet ribs.     Food arrived so quickly that our friends hadn't eaten more than two spoonfuls of their soup.   This is a server problem, not a kitchen problem.   Who wants to be rushed like that?  My nachos were enormous, but had likely  sat in the oven too long as the cheese was like a rock, and the pulled pork (what little there was), was as dry as anything.    My husbands ribs had so little meat on them, he couldn't understand what animal they had come from.    When food is this bad, I normally complain,  but we didn't want to make a fuss with our guests there.  They each got a sandwich and weren't saying anything, so we felt they were ok with their food.     Third time is supposed to be a charm, but not this time.   We need to find another restaurant that is half way for our get together with friends.

TG64rhw4ex50yZrHHBnLuQ.text: I ordered the smoked brisket dinner and the brisket was the fattiest mess I've ever encountered. I complained and the waitress told me this was the third complaint of the night regarding the brisket and it was only 6:00 pm.   They offered to replace my dinner with something else but I decline and just ate my sides. They wouldn't take the price of my meal off or even a percentage of the meal.   I will add a photo of this mess if possible.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokey Bones Bar & Fire Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States. 80% fat brisket. Stay away.

cBuguqf1STm8FlSqz3eAxw.text: My first time eating at smokey bones, I really enjoyed the wings, and our waitress melissa, was great at serving and explaining the food items on the menu. Keith & Lynn

e0UG1T-8GwAlPDV-B108OA.text: My family just left the Pittsburgh Mills location and it was an absolute NIGHTMARE!!! with 3 tables in the entire restaurant our food took 45 minutes and they forgot my 15yr olds food all together. When it got to the table it was cold. But they made sure my 7yr olds plate was scalding hot (with cold food) we had to ask for everything from straws for our drinks to plates for our cornbread. To end the experience my son used the restroom where there was feces on the walls, blood on the floor and NO hand soap!! Iv been a restaurant manager for the last 3 yrs so i tend to give a little slack but this was by far the worst experience I've ever had. And. The WORST $116 I HAVE EVER SPENT!!!

pPy1leM0FADWF7MmqgMf-Q.text: I've eaten at this Smokey Bones several times and at different locations. I really want to give them a higher rating but I can only bring myself to say that it is average.   The atmosphere is that if a sports bar with lots on TVs playing a variety of sporting events. There is both bar and dining area drains available. Most of the menu consists of BBQ recipes like pulled pork, brisket, ribs, etc. Other options are available such as pasta and salads and most restaurants offer.  At our most recent visit, we were made to wait for 15 minutes before being seated, despite the fact that the place wasn't even half full. They were clearly understaffed at the time which was the problem, but I do think this is unacceptable.   At the suggestion of the waiter, we tried the buffalo chicken dip app which was a new item on the menu. I thought it was weird because it was made of cut up chicken tenders with the cheese and hot sauce layered on top. I had the BBQ chicken meal which consisted of half of a chicken so if you order this, make sure you're hungry! It was moist but I wasn't overly impressed with the rub.   I've had better experiences here is the past which is why we stopped today, but I will probably go elsewhere in the future if I have other options.

photos.caption: Photo of Smokey Bones Bar & Fire Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States. BBQ chicken
Photo of Smokey Bones Bar & Fire Grill - Tarentum, PA, United States. Buffalo chicken dip

lMpGuOfHdgzFeO4E7v55HA.text: I was as pumped as a kid to get my grill and cook at the table. Saces were good but the meat was just awful I told them and they said thats just the way it comes. Never an offer to replace. So much potential but little care. So I dont care either! Every dollar is a vote and Ill vote elsewhere!

YZSGdb00ITEDV3SAQdFsWw.text: Would give it 0, but not a choice.  Drove past the place for several months after relocating to Pittsburgh.  Decided finally to try it out for a simple lunch on a Sunday afternoon.  Never made it past the abandoned hostess stand.  After waiting for minutes watching many workers walk by and not even acknowledge my presence, decided to walk out.  Forgot to mention that they were not even remotely busy.  Normally service at the front of a Resturant is a preamble for the service during the meal.  Good luck guys.

ci1FfZ8AsrtaKtfAubLZ9Q.text: We were very hungry and we're seated, sat there unnoticed for about ten minutes.  Another larger table came and the waiter I think it was Ken or something waited on them right away.  We got up and walked out unnoticed by the way and went next door to Olive Garden where we were treated properly.  Thanks for drawing us away.  Figured the place is owned by Kellogg's , one of the worst companies to work for.

CqqGIET4DDxNiGPzd7M4-g.text: After being seated we waited and waited and waited and waited, close to 15 minutes, and no server ever stopped. Got up and left. You would have thought either the hostess or cashier would have asked why we were leaving. Nope. 2nd time at this location (more than a year apart) with similar outcomes...there won't be a third.
